result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander Y Gallatin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period. If provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
CORRECTED Order for Treatment, signed, filed and disbursed.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties review and do not contest  Doctors Report.  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.    Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 21.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Order of Commitment for Treatment, signed filed and disbursed.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court in person, defendant Alexander Y Gallatin not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing 6/1/2022. Defendant has a lower pending matter 21CF814 that is set for a return on the doctors report. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Case is adjourned to Br. 21 Judge Davis for a return on doctors report along with 21CF814.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. OPD to appoint Attorney Cerniglia in this matter pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:07 AM Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel at this time. Defense needs to verify information to determine eligibility. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with C.C.L.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alexander Y Gallatin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
